授業方法: Seminar format. Each week we will pursue one specific task, which we will try to achieve with every student contributing to the class. There will be sufficient guidance and explanations given, which will enable the students to successfully work on and deliver their plenty assignments.

第1回: Introduction to the course
第2回: The university as an institution: History, development and peculiarities in Europe
第3回:
The university as an institution: History, development and peculiarities in other world regions.

Students’ presentations
第4回: Introduction to the library and its search tools
第5回: Library tour (main library and SIS library)
第6回:
Acquiring study and academic skills.

Researching issues related to the European Union
Student presentations and discussions
第12回:
See session 6 above
Last instructions for final report
第14回: Analysis of the final reports and instruction for rewriting the report (if necessary)

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school.
By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
General Foundation Courses (Practical Orientation):
1. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
2. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
3. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.
